title: To whoever in riot's balance team looked at ekko and thought "let him jungle"
body: Thank you so god damn much, i used to main ekko jungle and it was the most fun i've had, until tank ekko appeared and ruined everything, couldn't jungle with him anymore unless i had a ton of attack speed in my runes, making ekko's damage output early to champions just laughable, with this one single buff im able to enjoy ekko jungle and again, thank you.

Because some champions just have unfair jungling patterns like Tank Ekko of old, or current Camille.

What about it makes them "unfair" and not just their strength as a jungler?

How is it any more "unfair" than the current system of hard locking a substantial number of champions out of the jungle?
Well it depends on the kit of the champ. Camilie for example is difficult to stay healthy because of her ulti that disables any form of escapes.

You don't seem to understand the context.

Camille isn't an "unfair" jungler because her ult effectively disables all escape, at best you could claim she's an unfair champion, but if such a case were to be made, that still doesn't explain how that makes her unfair in the context of jungling.

She just has a completely successful gank every time her ult is off cd as long as she's not incompetent or gets burst down or counterganked. No other jungler can guarantee that you're stuck away from your turret with a point and click for 4+ seconds
Ok and, if the player isn't incompetent or denied, so do {{champion:54}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:19}} just to show that this isn't something unique to camille in any regard.

Well, that was kinda implied. The context of Jungling is **GANKS**. If you don't understand why a Camille jumping into your lane from 1100 range away from Fog of War and ulting you and you can't do anything about it is unfair, I can't say much more to explain.

Camille ulting you in lane is a totally different story. If she just does it straight out of the blue, you should be able to beat her / displace her / delay her until it fades out. It's a 1v1, you versus her, and you can see her coming.

So what you're saying is that Camille is actually just an unfair champion, when she gets a gank?

Because her being a laner or jungler changes nothing about that situation.

I agree, they shouldn't have buffs to make them an option.

They should have a basic degree of natural jungling competency, and that should be the extent of their jungling power. What shouldn't be going on, is riot picking favorites for who gets this extra jungling power and balancing the jungle to bias the particular design of champion that they want to be played in it. 

There's nothing that makes a lane inherently bias towards what kind of champions would be successful in it, beyond a few unique cases like illaoi in the mid lane. I don't think jungle should be getting a different design philosophy attached to it.

I don't want every champion to be good as a jungler, i just want every champion to have the ability to jungle. Viability be fucking damned.

The only way to really make it work is nerf the jungle until others that CAN jungle effectively clear the whole thing in seconds at full health (looking at yi, shyvana, etc) and are then ganking while these are still clearing. There is a serious deficiency in good AP junglers, right now.
